When Donald Trump said he wished there were a "fantastic" Republican candidate so he would not have to consider running himself, Ron Paul supporters shouted, " Ron Paul " as an alternative. Donald Trump said: I like Ron Paul . I think he's a good guy, but honestly he just has zero chance of getting elected. Everyone cheered except the Ron Paul supporters. their search results. I'm just curious whether it's possible, even if you have consumers' best interests at heart, that you might actually be doing harm to the broader field of tech innovation? If Google Inc. as a search engine loses sight of what users really want, I'm sure there will be enough companies out there willing to fulfill that need. That's why competition is such a good thing. It keeps everyone honest, and clearly it keeps every company involved focused on the users. I believe a competitive landscape, an open market, allows Google Inc. and other companies to do the right things for their users, because it's in their best interests when users are happy with the product.
